conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the voltage U across MN and the direction of the induced current through R.
Conductor rod MN moves with velocity v perpendicular to magnetic field B. Length of rod MN is l.
Induced EMF in the rod is given by E = B * l * v.
Rod MN and fixed resistor R form a closed circuit. Resistance of rod MN is R.
Total resistance in the circuit is 2R.
Current I in the circuit is I = E / 2R = (B * l * v) / 2R.
Voltage U across rod MN is U = I * R = (B * l * v) / 2.
Use the right-hand rule to determine the direction of the induced current.
Induced current flows from N to M through rod MN and from b to d through resistor R.
Magnitude of voltage U across MN is U = (B * l * v) / 2.
Direction of induced current through fixed resistor R is from b to d.
